costa off-ee Diego Costa escapes a Chelsea club fine as he is allowed back to train with squad 
Top scorer back in first-team fold under Antonio Conte and wasn't punished for bust-up over fitness By DUNCAN WRIGHT Comments DIEGO COSTA has escaped any punishment from Chelsea for his training ground bust-up last week. 
Costa had been forced to train alone at the club’s Cobham training centre after being axed for the trip to Leicester following a bust-up with boss Antonio Conte . Reuters 3 Diego Costa has escaped a fine from Chelsea for his bust-up last week 
The row over his fitness and a back injury led to Costa being dumped from the first-team squad, who went on to win 3-0 against the Foxes last week. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Chelsea news , gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
He was then f orced to spend Monday training on his own while his teammates enjoyed a welcome day off, amid fears he was pushing for a move to China. Jim Bennett 3 Diego Costa was forced to train alone on Monday at the Chelsea training ground in Cobham 
The 14-goal striker was finally allowed back to link up with the senior squad on Tuesday after he ironed out his differences with Conte and Julio Tous. 
It was a row with ex-Italy coach Tous last week that started the chain of events that led to Costa being axed by his manager. 
Chelsea were initially unwilling to let the Spanish international off the hook completely and had looked at imposing a fine on the player – but now they have decided to let the incident pass with just a warning. 
Costa will remain at Chelsea for the remainder of the season despite interest from the Chinese Super League, where he was offered around £575,000-a-week to join. The owner of newly promoted Tianjin Quanjian yesterday admitted he had held talks with Costa's agent Jorge Mendes about signing the forward, but was told he was not available until the summer. 
Chelsea are desperate for Costa to get back firing again as their man striker in the club's fight to win the Premier League. 
Conte's side currently hold a seven point lead at the top of the table ahead of Tottenham and Liverpool - but they only have unproven Michy Batshuayi as back-up in the main striking role.
